result.execSummary:
The defendant Louis J. Stone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Louis J. Stone is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Louis J. Stone was found guilty of False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Louis J. Stone was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Louis J. Stone was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Louis J. Stone was found guilty of Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Schiek/Dickens/Court statement on sentencing.

Was not obligated to pay restitution; psych evalu was not required by PO; AODA - was seeing LDF Family Resource Center - letter provided to DA - probation was revoked. Court notes that this is a Branch 1 case and schedules hearing before Judge O'Melia. Agreement to remain in effect. Bail continued. 11:10 a.m. Defendant Louis J. Stone in court, in custody, with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 15CF197. Plea questionnaire and waiver filed/letter attached with agreed disposition. Schiek moves to dismiss but read in case 15CF197; granted. Defendant pleads no contest to Cts 1,3,4,5 in 15CF1.  Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Cts. 1,3,4,5. Court defers entry of judgment on Ct. 1. DEJ filed. Schiek/Finlan/Stone statement to sentencing. Court statement. Schiek requests signature bond, with no contact provision with Christa Casey. Court modifies bond to $5,000 signature bond; no contact with Christa Casey. Expungement of DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) language. Ct. 1 - DEJ/Restitution provided by Schiek w/in 30 days. Off the record-/minute entry only--State moves to dismiss Cts. 6,7 in 15CF1; granted.
